title: Between September 2017 and February 2018, how many people will be killed by sectarian actors in Nigeria?
preds:
I received a response from CoFR about the Nigeria Security Tracker. I asked who is considered a "sectarian actor". They replied: "Sectarian refers to an incident that involves violence attributed to clashes between "identity" actors. So this would include references to clashes between "xxx communities", violence attributed to "fulani herdsmen," or clashes between "farmers and pastoralists."  The term is fairly broad, so the count may even go over 750. For 2018 only, fatalities by actor: Bachama Ethnic Militia - 40
Bororos Ethnic Militia - 1
Fulani Ethnic Militia - 294
Gomba Communal Militia - 2
Irigwe Ethnic Militia - 2
Ogbe-Ijoh Ethnic Militia - 4
TOTAL so far in 2018 (ACLED): 343
TOTAL from Sept-Dec 2017 (Security Tracker): 356
TOTAL so far (Security Tracker + ACLED): 699 This is according to "actor 1" on the ACLED spreadsheet. I don't know if "actor 1" is always the perpetrator. I have compared the period 1 Sept-30 Dec 2017 on the ACLED spreadsheet and the CoFR Nigeria Security Tracker. I found that ACLED has 255 deaths attributed to communal, ethnic, or regional militias (as "actor 1") during that period (excluding Boko Haram, which the Security Tracker lists separately). The Security Tracker has 356. I don't have an explanation for the discrepancy. Correction: A few more deaths have been added on the latest edition of the ACLED spreadsheet, bringing the 2018 deaths to 347.
Currently 498 deaths. Almost at the end of this month, assuming there will be at least 2 more in the month of February, but I haven't heard of anything extreme happening yet this month there.

https://data.humdata.org/dataset/acled-data-for-nigeria Filtering for Sept 1 2018 to Feb 2018 and  'Battle - Government regains Territory',  'Battle - non-state actor overtakes territory' 132
Including 'Battle - No change of Territory', yielded 906 fatalities Not sure what will be classified as 'sectarian'

These data from CFR updates monthly, so it's a bit harder to 'guess' when the question closes before we see the data.  Are there any data in a weekly cycle somewhere? For all we know there could be a handful of attacks that accumulate over 250 deaths or so pushing it to the next brackt of >750 - <1,000.

Depending upon which factions are being included in the Security Tracker's "sectarian actors", it could go over 750. Through December 2017, the Tracker has 356. There may be 294 from Fulani militias alone so far in 2018 (based on ACLED "actor 1"). That comes to 650 with a week more to go and presumably more militias to be included. If I include Bachama militias as "actor 1", the total for 2018 comes to 334. That raises the total so far to 690. Fulani are Muslim herdsmen. Bachama are Christian farmers. Not sure if the security tracker is considering them "sectarian" as their primary concerns may be ethnic or resource-related rather than religious.

If the Nigeria Security Tracker is including Fulani Militias as "sectarian actors", it will go over 500 for the time period September 2017 through February 2018. According to ACLED, there have been 294 deaths with "actor 1" as Fulani ethnic militia so far in 2018 (not including Sept-Dec 2017). Questions remain, however: What factions is the Security Tracker including in "sectarian actor"? Does "actor 1" in the ACLED dataset always mean that is the perpetrator (as opposed to victim)? (I have emailed the first question.)

Tracker has not updated in a while. Still says 356 death by Sectarian Actor since end of August 2017. @Ken_Barnes says it will update in early March. The Tracker updated early January. Maybe they update every two months. There is no telling what data will end up in the tracker by the time the question is resolved. It's looking like GJO will have to wait two months before resolving the question. I am finding it difficult to compare CFR data to ACLED because it doesn't say which factions are included in deaths by "Sectarian Actor". Boko Haram are excluded. Are the Fulani included? Bachama? I thought those distinctions were primarily ethnic, not religious. https://qz.com/1204744/nigeria-fulani-herdsmen-clashes-are-redefining-its-geopolitics/
not sure when gjo will call *time*
Heading higher and feeling frustrated that I can't rely on the monthly tracker but deciding to trust the community.

603 deaths based on weekly tracker counts, with 12 days to go in February.  1 in 10 chance of another 50+ death massacre that might put us into the 751-999 bracket. I'm really getting shirty that I have to keep a 1 in 20 insurance against the Monthly Tracker not updating, and GJO resolving this question using the out-of-date data.

If I am reading the Maps correctly, it seems like there are just over 600 deaths between sectarian actors and non-state Boko Haram so far. From what I have read, deaths usually come in very small numbers around specific attacks. This makes me think that there will not be over 100 more deaths in the last couple weeks of this time period. I could be reading the maps wrong and be way off though.
Maybe I'm missing something, but I see only 356 deaths recorded with one month to go? Suggests to me that under 500 is still a real possibility.

starting to narrow it down
there seems to be lot of doubts here in the community about using which data.
I am sticking with my eariler assumptions on the data used. There seems not to be any grave incidence for that, the likelyhood in my opinion narrows down  on the 500-750 range
Thanks @Ken_Barns. I like the logic for under 500 and am adjusting accordingly to 3.

Watching the weekly tracker, the pace seems to be chuckling along about about 20 deaths/week, or 3 deaths per day ever since the 120 or so deaths in early January.  That means that things will probably run in at about 600-650 by the end of February. However, the failure of the Monthly Tracker, which is the official gauge for resolving this question, to update since early January is ... ominous. For that reason, I maintain a 4% chance (1:24) that the Monthly Tracker fails to update past 500, and GJO resolves the question before the Monthly Tracker can update to concord with the Weekly Tracker totals. A smaller chance (1:49) that there is another massacre or two in the next couple of weeks that pushes the total above 750 AND the Tracker captures that data before the question resolves.

So apparently (and factoring in average monthly deaths) it is already over 500 mark. Sad.  Thanks @MichalBod for correcting me
@michalbod (hyperlink fails unless the name matches case sensitivity exactly. Weird)

23rd of September must have just seemed so bloody. Dropping from 99% at  1000+ to <500. I'm such a flipper.  Currently at 335 but the average (for total - with Boko Haram doing the most) seems to be around the 300 mark as an eyeballed ballpark guesstimate [when you chop off the extreme plus 1k peak spikes]. So it could easily trip over the 500 mark, if things get volatile again over the next 2 weeks.

Increasing B-H muscle flexing will see decentralized IED/suicide bombers in larger and traditionally less targeted cities--Abuja, for example. Coupled with activities in SE Nigeria/Delta region there may be blow back from government attempts to exert more control and/or a larger mix of MNC "militias" attempting to protect oil infrastructure that may come into contact with local separatists. Combustible mix of government, corporate, and local guerrillas.

https://www.gjopen.com/comments/comments/687672
https://www.gjopen.com/comments/comments/682987 raising my choice on info and work by @ken_burns, @JS, @SMH5
@JS thank you for your good contributions which convinced me to shift  % higher up the scale.

Do they ever revise monthly totals upwards?  Tracker strangely has January total at 55 Sectarian deaths but their raw data has the number at 201.  If the January total of 55 holds, and the accurate cumulative total for September, October, November, December, and January is 356, then its a good bet the total is under 500.  However, if the January tracker numbers are revised to match the raw data totals (from 55 to 201), then we're already past 500 fatalities.  Unfortunately it is not clear how/when/or why the tracker numbers differ from the raw NST data.  This is a bad question and should probably be withdrawn.

i am getting more and more convinced that the number will surpass the 500.
see my earlier comments , also when i based some of my analytics on ACLED instead of CFR. Also thanks to the very good contributions of @JS and @Ken_Barns

Edit: this is above 500. @Resonancia :) @Ken_Barns Not sure what happened, but I cannot reply to your comment where it is placed (could just upvote it). I am fine with keeping a small residual probability! In general, GjOpen specified in the past (and I think it's also mentioned sooomewhere in the faq or training manual) that the closing date of a question doesn't have to align with the resolution date at all (as it also often does not), but that the resolution comes sometime after the data comes in. I agree that a sentence specifiying that might be useful just to avoid confusion, as - by looking at the median -  I have to assume has been the case here? edit#2: I used ACLED as reference to check whether any numbers have been off/might be changed in the monthly update. Based on ACLEDs data I came to the conclusion, that the only possible way to change data would be upwards. :o) So that's why I am at 0%; but yes, I also think it's not unreasonable to be a bit cautious.

@JS thanks for both replies, very helpful indeed. In fact I was struggling exporting data from that website you gave me the link. I did it again and ? Succeeded!  :-))   many thanks !!!
I did now sum up all numbers from 2.Sept 17 to 2. Feb18. all not only Fulanis and sum up to 457.  Interesting is that in the entire table either actir nr 1 or nr 2 is a Fulani.  pls cross examine my findings however based on these findings i am going to change my earlier judgement  96/4. on 500/500-750. to new 45/55 on the same
Sticking to 90% under 500 and 10% 500-750. As of feb 2, sitting at about 350.

Counting the reported deaths of the weekly reports from January, adding the number of deaths in the previous months and substracting the 55 that already got included in the update for december although the event happened in january,  I end up with 439 deaths for the whole period until January 26th so far. Four weeks and five days to go. After comparing this with ACLED Data and news reports, I assume that the overall monthly number for January will def. surpass the added number of the weekly reports. Based on last months track records, I also assume that 10-15 deaths per week is not unrealistic. This will likely lead to over 500.

Graph 2 does not seem to be updated weekly. It was stale since end of December so I have added each "Security Tracker Weekly Update" starting 9/2/2017 and got 493 as of 1/26/2018.   356 which is shown on graph 2 currently probably shows number as of  end of December. However graph 2 does not tie to weekly updates. When counted weekly updates from 9/2 till end of Dec I got 300. however there was huge massacre beginning of January where 124 people were killed.  Based on above I think 500 will be surpassed . I hope I am wrong here.

Sectarian violence has already killed about 350 people  from September to the end of the year, so going over 500 seems likely. Sectarian violence is also the fastest growing portion of violence, so even as overall deaths slow, it seems likely that these deep-seated grudges will continue with like-for-like raids at slow but steady rates.
High death tolls bring too much international pressure.
I believe the rate will unfortunately be approximately 500 per month.
previous forecast was a mistake; only change here: I dropped the 1% for "More than 750" and gave this to "Less than 500"
I note that the monthly total of deaths recorded by the tracker that will be used to official adjudicate the result does not exactly match numbers given in the daily/weekly updates.

356 deaths through the end of December. It's possible to break 500 averaging another 75/month, but as @praedico notes, most of the deaths occurred in October, with the other 3 months at or below 71 deaths per month. If that maintains, it's unlikely to break 500 before the end of February.

Recent updates to the Security Tracker: Deaths by Sectarian Actor since end of Aug 2017: 356
September: 21
October: 166
November: 71
December: 43 I don't know if number for December is final, but chances of reaching 500 at this rate are slim.

Oh bollocks, oh bollocks.  Another weekly update a couple of hours after my last forecast.  *Shakes head*  That brings us up to 29 December. OK, looks like 44 deaths from 1st to 29th of December. Let's call that 50 for the month (long-term average of 3 per day). That brings a total of 308 deaths in 4 months (mean of 77/mth). Will there be 191- deaths in next 2 months, or will there be 192+ deaths? Of the 23 rolling 2-month-total-deaths from "Jan-Feb 2016" until "Nov-Dec 2017", 13 have had 191- deaths, and 10 have had 192+ deaths. Odds of 13:10 equals 57:43. As a double check, the short-term (last 4 months) mean is 77 deaths a month. The long-term mean (since May 2011) is 96 deaths a month. The medium-term (last 2 years) mean is 89 deaths a month. We need a mean of 96 deaths a month for the next 2 months to get to a total of 500 deaths. Both forms of assessment converge on 499- about as likely as 500+.

Oh bollocks, scratch that.  I found the weekly updates.  *face palm* OK, looks like only 26 deaths from 1st to 26th of December.  Let's call that 30 for the month.  That brings a total of 288 deaths in 4 months (mean of 72/mth).  Will there be 211- deaths in next 2 months, or will there be 212+ deaths? Of the 23 rolling 2-month-total-deaths from "Jan-Feb 2016" until "Nov-Dec 2017", 15 have had 211- deaths, and 8 have had 212+ deaths. Odds of 15:8 equals 65:35. As a double check, the short-term (last 4 months) mean is 72 deaths a month. The long-term mean (since May 2011) is 96 deaths a month. The medium-term (last 2 years) mean is 89 deaths a month. We need a mean of 106 deaths a month for the next 2 months to get to a total of 500 deaths. Both forms of assessment converge on 499- being somewhat more likely than 500+.

Forecast made purely on analysis of past monthly "Sectarian Actor" deaths from January 2016 onwards. Of the 6 months covered by the forecast, 258 deaths in 3 months so far.  Will there be 241- deaths in next 3 months, or will there be 242+ deaths? Of the 21 rolling 3-month-total-deaths from "Jan-Mar 2016" until "Sep-Nov 2017", 9 have had 241- deaths, and 12 have had 242+ deaths.  Odds of 9:12 equals 43:57. As a double check, the short-term (last 3 months) mean is 86 deaths a month.  The long-term mean (since May 2011) is 97 deaths a month.  The medium-term (last 2 years) mean is 91 deaths a month.  We only need a mean of 81 deaths a month for the next 3 months to get to a total of 500 deaths. Both forms of assessment converge on 500+ being a little more likely than 499-. [ps.  Is anyone aware of any more frequent tracker than the CFR website??  I was burnt by using past data, rather than current Facebook updates, to forecast on the recent Syrian civilian deaths question ...]

258 when checked on 1 January 2018, deaths only through end of November.  September: 21 (slider set to Aug 2017-Sept 2017)
October: 187 (slider set to Sept 2017 -Oct 2017)
November:  50 (slider set to Oct 2017 - Nov 2017 is not working correctly) 
December: ? Numbers are erratic. It's not clear if all deaths from November have been recorded. This is averaging 86 deaths by sectarian actor per month. Three months left (including December). Was October an anomaly?
Boko Haram is the biggest bad actor in Nigeria, so any deaths involved with them are atributed to them, even thier own. Other conflicts are small in comparison.
Shifting lower, looks like the number won't get anywhere near 500 unless there is a massive increase in violence in the next month or so.

as usual I am so interested in Nigeria
the more I learn
the more I know
i don't know
my understanding is an outsized portion of the deaths are from relatively few events. (E.g., 2 events = 80-90 deaths).
258 so far for Sep-Nov. If that trend continues, it'll be an over/under on 500.

9 for november 2017?
its not like peace is breaking out in Chadian basin
but the stats are the stats
10 by Boko in one day
compare Reuters
"Suicide bombers kill 10 in Nigeria’s Maiduguri: emergency official
BY REUTERS ON NOVEMBER 16, 2017	
still image taken from a video shows people carrying a dead body, after a suicide bomb attack in the northeast Nigerian city of Maiduguri
A still image taken from a video shot on November 16, 2017, shows people carrying a dead body, after a suicide bomb attack in the northeast Nigerian city of Maiduguri, Nigeria. REUTERS/via Reuters TV
By Ahmed Kingimi MAIDUGURI, Nigeria (Reuters) – Suicide bomb attackers killed 10 people and wounded 30 in the northeast Nigerian city of Maiduguri on Wednesday, an emergency agency official said. Islamist militant group Boko Haram has killed more than 20,000 people since 2009 as part of its attempt to create an Islamic state in the Lake Chad basin. No one immediately claimed responsibility for the latest attack, which emergency officials and members of a government-approved vigilante group said was carried out by four female bombers in the Muna Garage district of Maiduguri at about 06:00 p.m. (1700 GMT). The use of female bombers is a hallmark of Boko Haram attacks. “We have so far recorded 10 people’s deaths and about 30 victims injured,” said Bello Dambatta, a spokesman for the State Emergency Agency (SEMA). Maiduguri is the capital of Borno state and the city worst hit by the jihadist insurgency. At least 221 people have been killed in bombings and gun attacks in northeast Nigeria since June, according to a Reuters tally".
Still 193 since end of August. Graphic has not updated in a few weeks. Number for November will be key. October number was high.

keep getting questions wrong (recently the polio q) --> from this i conclude that i need more epistemic humility generally... --> relaxing confidence further on this question data in this question are not as extreme a representation of fat tail as the following example, I think it the principle still roughly applies to this q.
https://twitter.com/nntaleb/status/932061416844034050

"Sectarian actors" sounds like the folks who perform at Oberammergau or The Hill Cumorah or the seven-year-olds in your local church's Christmas do.   Very few of these, I think, kill people in Nigeria.  One strives to maintain proper focus....

193 deaths since end of August. So... September: 21 deaths
October: 166 deaths
November: 6 deaths so far This rate would put the total over 500 for September to February, but it's very uneven and only 2 months' sample.

Now that the graph has been updated (thanks @Gibson for catching that), from Sep 1 until today (although probably Oct 31 based on the data), there has been 193 deaths attributed to Sectarian Actors. As such, I'm balancing out my forecast with a slight edge towards the 500-750 range based on the significant uptick from the end of Sep to the end of Oct.

looks like they finally updated the graph 2 that decides this question and we're at 172 deaths.
@danbell7819 @dsarin @lsgold7 @acohen @cdob63 @praedico

Today's edition of cfr's security tracker for 10/21-26 mentions 120 people may have been killed in a single incident, but notes other sources refute the incident as quote-unquote fake news. The incident nevertheless appears on the map color-coded for "sectarian actor."
Shifting toward under 500 because there hasn't been much sectarian violence in the last two months.
21 deaths recorded since beginning of August 2017. They're all for August. The Security Tracker isn't listing anything for September yet. Downward trend continues.

Here is my forecasting error persistently.
There are overwhelmingly facts on the ground problems. 
That is why one can make inferences but Rohingyas illustrate by contrast.
Bbc.com fantastic 
On grwnfell towers 
Not in Nigeria.
If us is taking casualties and Nigeria is so important 
So all wrong always on Nigeria 
It's a us France ISIS front
Sectarian violence will certainly not abate in the short run.
Dropping a little lower and hoping the number of deaths is emblematic of the trend in Nigeria for the next several months.

21 deaths for 9/1/17 to 10/1/17 according to the tracker. Assuming that trend stays relatively constant, it would shake out to somewhere between 100-200 deaths by sectarian actors by 2/28/18. However, I'm hedging a little as the situation is volatile and can see a sharp spike in fatalities rather quickly.
the awareness of sectarian violence like boko haram is helping to prevent deaths
getting better with boko haram. even haven't read anything the last few months about them. Trend
I believe during the Christmas period the christians will come under attack.

Over the past 6 months, there have been 512 deaths by sectarian actors. 73 in last 2 months, 250 in last 3 months. 261 in 3 months before that.  It's showing only 7 deaths for August -seems like that is not be fully updated- so I can't tell if the trend is down. I'll assume it's not until August numbers are updated.  Hard to know where to put these numbers, as consensus has not yet been established. Will adjust in a couple of weeks.

Well the average number of deaths per month in the last year has been 87, which is quite a bit lower than in years past. It is entirely possible that sectarian violence will pick up again in the next few months but I think we end up around 500 deaths, roughly the average for the last year.

Looking back in 6-month intervals (3/1 to 9/1, and 9/1 to 3/1 - you can manually type in the start and end dates instead of using the slide bars) to the start of the data (5/1/11), the average number of deaths by sectarian actors is 684 per 6-month period. The high mark came in 3/1-9/1/14, when 1,432 were killed. After this peak, deaths dropped by half, and have continued to decline to around the 500 mark. Here is the data:
Start---------End----------Deaths
3/1/2017---9/1/2017---512
9/1/2016---3/1/2017---494
3/1/2016---9/1/2016---497
9/1/2015---3/1/2016---641
3/1/2015---9/1/2015---658
9/1/2014---3/1/2015---772
3/1/2014---9/1/2014---1432
9/1/2013---3/1/2014---987
3/1/2013---9/1/2013---1159
9/1/2012---3/1/2013---686
3/1/2012---9/1/2012---462
9/1/2011---3/1/2012---431
5/1/2011---9/1/2011---163 Given that the last two year have been relatively stable, I don't see this trend increasing significantly. However, as illicit oil refining takes off again, militias throughout the region could quickly ramp up the violence again, as was seen between 2012-2014.  Starting with an over-under on 500, with a small bucket in the over 750 category.
